dialogue.text: That your obsessive control—the mental death grip on life's handlebars—isn't saving you. It's isolating you. It's burning your fuel on fear.

visual_elements.architect_gesture: face palm as recognition of universal human folly
visual_elements.environment: studio suddenly feeling like confession booth

psychological_notes: The face palm gesture shows the Architect's recognition of this universal pattern. The 'death grip' metaphor reveals how our attempts at control become what kills vitality. Fear as fuel burning captures the exhausting nature of hypervigilance.
philosophical_underpinning: The harder we grip, the less we hold; control becomes its own prison
therapeutic_direction: Recognizing control strategies as symptoms not solutions
